title: What terms contribute to the possible rational zeros?
text: The only possible rational zeros of f(x) are the quotients of the factors of the last term, $$-4$$, and the factors of the leading coefficient, $$2$$.
speech: The only possible rational zeros of f(x) are the quotients of the factors of the last term,  minus 4 , and the factors of the leading coefficient,  2 .
pacedSpeech: The only possible rational zeros of f(x) are the quotients of the factors of the last term,   minus 4
, and the factors of the leading coefficient,   2

title: Factors of the Constant Term
text: What are the factors of the constant term, -4? From here on, these factors will be denoted as $$p$$, factors of the constant term.
speech: What are the factors of the constant term, -4? From here on, these factors will be denoted as  p , factors of the constant term.
pacedSpeech: What are the factors of the constant term, -4? From here on, these factors will be denoted as   p
, factors of the constant term.

title: What are the factors of the constant term, -4? (List them in ascending order as such: $$-2$$, $$-1$$, $$1$$, ...)
text: There are $$6$$ in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.
speech: There are  6  in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.
pacedSpeech: There are   6
in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.

title: What are the factors of the leading coefficient, 2? From here on, these factors will be denoted as q, factors of the leading coefficient.
What are the factors of the leading coefficient, 2? (List them in ascending order as such: $$-2$$, $$-1$$, $$1$$, ...)
text: There are $$4$$ in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.
speech: There are  4  in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.
pacedSpeech: There are   4
in total. Consider that there are negative factors as well.

title: What are the different combination of rational zeros?
text: Consider that a rational zero is of the form $$\frac{p}{q}$$ where $$p$$ are factors of the constant term and q are factors of the leading coefficient. It would help to list out all your $$p$$ and q to write out the different combination.
speech: Consider that a rational zero is of the form , p over q,  where  p  are factors of the constant term and q are factors of the leading coefficient. It would help to list out all your  p  and q to write out the different combination.
pacedSpeech: Consider that a rational zero is of the form  , p over q,
where   p
are factors of the constant term and q are factors of the leading coefficient. It would help to list out all your   p
and q to write out the different combination.

title: What are the possible rational zeros with $$p$$ $$=$$ $$+-1$$?
text: Recall what are the factors of $$2$$, q, that you've previously found.
speech: Recall what are the factors of  2 , q, that you've previously found.
pacedSpeech: Recall what are the factors of   2
, q, that you've previously found.

title: The combination of all q with $$p$$ $$=$$ +- $$1$$ are $$+-\left(\frac{1}{1}\right)$$, $$+-\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)$$
What are the possible rational zeros with $$p=+-2$$?

Simplify all the rational zeros that you have found so that there are no duplicates.
